In Benin during the CAF Cup final, an unruly set of speciators almosi tore the cloth of CAF Presi- dent Issa Hayatou, as the policemen stayed aloof because the scene would not provide 'egunje' for them. Hayatou, billed to receive FIFA Inspection team in Lagos, quickly disappeared from the coun- try and returned briefly for the draw. Then the Mascot. The secrecy and promises that preceded the unveil- ing had made everyone believe that the Mascot was an Ingenuous piece of thought. Again, for God's sake, where in the world does an elephant fly? Whoever advised the LOC to pick an elephant for a nation whose sporting outings on the international scene is identified with flying ob- jects is as dumb as they come. Nnaji noted that Lagos State has been in the fore front in the produc- tion and development of potential talents who have represented the state in National and International Championships, All-Africa Games, World Championships and Olympic Games. "And the grooming ground for these feats is the youth competi- tion which DTE has come out to identify with." AFRICAN CLUB COMPETITIONS Olukanmi Advocates E arly Preparations AFRICAN CLUB COMPETITIONS Olukanmi Advocates E arly Preparations

An NFA board member, Chief FemiOlukanmi has advised clubs going continental nextseason to start preparations now, so as to have formidable and well- blended teams before the matches kick off. An NFA board member, Chief FemiOlukanmi has advised clubs going continental nextseason to start preparations now, so as to have formidable and well- blended teams before the matches kick off.

Chief Olukanmi, pro-board chair- man, said early preparation by these clubs would be an added advantage to the clubs in order to bring honours to the country next season. Chief Olukanmi, pro-board chair- man, said early preparation by these clubs would be an added advantage to the clubs in order to bring honours to the country next season.

- Speaking to PMsport last week, the Oota of Olubadan also advised an early kick off of next year's league to enable teams know the good and the bad in their teams. - Speaking to PMsport last week, the Oota of Olubadan also advised an early kick off of next year's league to enable teams know the good and the bad in their teams.

"If we can start our league as early as January, by the time continental matches kick off in March, our repre- sentatives would have blend. "If we can start our league as early as January, by the time continental matches kick off in March, our repre- sentatives would have blend.

"1 don't believe we can't win the Champions Cup next year. If BCC can put their act together, fortify some defective areas in the team, I see them bringing the Sekou Toure Cup to the country next year." "1 don't believe we can't win the Champions Cup next year. If BCC can put their act together, fortify some defective areas in the team, I see them bringing the Sekou Toure Cup to the country next year."

"My advice to all our represen- tatives in continental championship next year is to be well organised and have sound preparation, so Nigeri- ans can smile next year," Chief Olukanmi said. - Femi Olabode "My advice to all our represen- tatives in continental championship next year is to be well organised and have sound preparation, so Nigeri- ans can smile next year," Chief Olukanmi said. - Femi Olabode
NFA Summons Ugwu NFA Summons Ugwu

Following fraud allegations ley- elled against NFA's pro-league departme at by Shooting Stars' central defender, Benedict Ugwu, the nation's hig est soccer ruling house has summoned the former national player to appear in its secretariat, Following fraud allegations ley- elled against NFA's pro-league departme at by Shooting Stars' central defender, Benedict Ugwu, the nation's hig est soccer ruling house has summoned the former national player to appear in its secretariat,

PMsport gathered last week that shocked NFA officials met for two hours over the bribery and fraud allegations which Benedict Ugwu claimed rocked this year's league, before concluding to summon the player who is expected to come forward with his facts. "This is a very serious matter which is being treated accordingly. We have already in vited the 3SC's player to come and present his facts, so we can get to the root of the matter.
